Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Melanie W
Reviews.Content: We've been there many times for weekend trips to Orlando. The accommodations are nice, and they have a great pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Well Maintained”
Reviews.Author: OldManWanderer
Reviews.Content: I am a Wyndam owner and reserved a 1 BR Deluxe unit for last weekend in October 2011 to attend a Josh Groban concert. This is a shared timeshare rental property. Wyndam has about one half of the facility. Our unit was well maintained quite roomy. Master had jaccuzi tub and very comfortable king sized bed. There is a full kitchen, dining and living room. Also a balcony with table & 4 chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: jeffmullen
Reviews.Content: As a Wyndham owner it really surprises me of all the restrictions this resort has. They treated me like a thief or something. Every time I called to ask for something the operator would tell me something like "when did you check in we gave you all the dishwashing detergent that is needed." Two packs for seven days is not enough. I asked for towels and was asked again when did you check in! We only give towels out on Wednesdays. That was five days into my vacation. If you want to play tennis, ping pong, or some other game that you have to use equipment better have your drivers license or you won't play the game located in the swimming area. I have been to other resorts and you give them the room number with a security code and you can charge drinks get equipment or whatever you need without carrying your wallet to the swimming area. This place really sucks and I won't be back to this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “star island”
Reviews.Author: pwrightd
Reviews.Content: just had one of the best holidays that we can remember and have been coming out to florida for over 10 yrs now location is great apartments large and roomy with very friendly staff nothing is a problem great for golf dozens of courses near by D Wright (Scotland)

Reviews.Title: “Great resort to relax at after doing Orlando attractions”
Reviews.Author: mom2kgirls
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort 3 times this spring and summer with my teenagers and loved it! THe location is great- near attractions, but set off the road on Lake Cecile, so it is secluded- we even saw a heron nest and the following month the baby hatchling following it's mother! Not too often you get a chance to enjoy nature in the middle of a tourist area! It is large enough to offer a variety of activities- small beach, watersports, pool with games and music, game room and family night activities, but it is small enough that I felt comfortable letting my kids roam around and do their own thing. THey had a great time and enjoyed the independence. I went to the spa, which I have never done before. They had a great special and I felt truly relaxed and pampered! We visited local attractions and Universal while there, enjoyed coming back to the relaxing atmosphere of the resort. THe staff was fabulous. Whether we needed extra chairs, bedding or towels, they brought them to us immediately, even at 1am! The front desk gave great suggestions and directions, answered all our questions politely! The most important thing to know when booking this resort is that if you have up to 4 people, chose the deluxe "B" side with the king bed and pullout sofa. It is so much bigger and nicer with a full kitchen and balcony than the smaller "A" units with 2 beds in the bedroom, and a kitchenette. After being in both, my kids chose the pullout and more room overall in the unit than having the second bed in the bedroom. Both are nice, but the extra space and balcony are especially more relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: bobmmp
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long trip to Orlando/Kissimee and stayed stayed at the Star Island property. I had read some of the reviews and was pleasantly surprised by the resort. As Wyndham Owners, the room was available on short notice. I booked a few weeks out. We had a B side unit (one bedroom deluxe) that was spacious and clean. We were located on the 5 floor and had a great view of the area. Bed was comfortable but not A+. The kitchen was full size, however, cooking utilities (pots and pans). The fitness room was top notch. The pool and poolside bar was a very pleasant surprise also. Prices at the bar were very reasonable and the staff throughout was great. There were plenty of near by places to eat, everything from fast food to fine dining. Bottom line, we would stay at this resort again. RATING B+

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort!”
Reviews.Author: bevanhowey
Reviews.Content: Another great resort reservation through Wyndham!! Second floor room was spacious and clean, with a nice balcony. Lovely pool was a short walk, as our building was in the rear of the property. Pool/bar dj was great, drinks reasonable, and there were several fun pool-side activities for kids and adults. Resort is very convieniently located, especially if you are spending time at Disney. (Only 2 turns to Disney, couldn't get lost if you tried!) Resturants and grocery store are less than a mile away, and some deliver to the resort. Would recommend maybe another pool area, less kid-oriented (quieter), for vacationers without children. Other than that, wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Lysol flavored mildew... with just a hint of nicotine.”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgntMom
Reviews.Content: My young sons and I stayed at the Bonnet Creek Resort at Disney for the past week, but due to some accidental scheduling/ points misuse we ended up one day short for our vacation. Star Island was the only resort available with short notice for a one day stay with the group of people we are traveling with. (We are guests of owners and travel with them at least 1-2 times a year). *Bonnet Creek is awesome...FYI!* Upon arriving at Star, we were able to check into our unit at 11am (absolutely unheard of at other resorts...so this was very good). The desk staff was very friendly and checkout went very quickly. We had a lock-off unit reserved (one side for my parents and the other side for myself and my children). As we entered the unit, the smell of smoke & mildew was really strong. My parents side didn't smell too bad, but our side of the unit was unbearable. I personally have allergies and it was just too much to stand. Basically seemed as though they had left the windows open in the rain for about a month, then closed everything up and let it sit for six months. You could even see mildew in the window seals... I called the front desk and they offered to have someone come and "air it out" with spray. LOL> yeah, that'll be tasty...Lysol flavored mildew with just a hint of nicotine. I told her that I needed an entirely NEW unit and she quickly accommodated to move our entire party to a new lock-off. The new unit smelled so MUCH better and had a lovely view of the elevator shaft on one side and the 40 rusty AC units on the other. Nothing like a pleasant view. :) Honestly, though- it smelled a ton better. The carpets look really clean because of all the lines from the vacuum, but upon further inspection- it ain't really clean. There was a weird brown gunk in the bathtub that I had to scrub out and there are dead bugs everywhere... the floors, the shower, the refrigerator, the sink... Not the most pleasant feeling in the world. But, hey- it's only for one night and it's a bed. AND- the pool area is really nice- actually liked it better than Bonnet Creek's pool area. A little more about the room...The dead bolt doesn't work so I'm going to sleep with one eye open. The studio unit is a ton smaller than the other part of the lock-off unit- so if you are planning on come down as two couples- somebody's gonna have to fight it out for the "nice" unit. The other side is about three times the size of this one, has a full size kitchen, big jacuzzi, large living area, walk-out balcony and two bathroom sinks. No, I'm not jealous....I just love my glorified hotel room with wicker furniture & a bed comforter from 1993. It's really outdated, but looks like they are trying to renovate some of the towers over time. So, in a nutshell...if you are used to a little hotel room- you'll be just fine with Star Island as long as they give you a clean room and you don't mind the outdated decor. BUT- if you are an owner and are expecting a little "something more"...you'll be disappointed in a BIG way.

Reviews.Title: “eh...”
Reviews.Author: lucy7852
Reviews.Content: We were given time share points as a gift and we chose Star Island because we wanted to be near Disney. I think if we had not been given this gift we probably would have just stayed on Disney property. We were there Thanksgiving week and really enjoyed the pool and hot tub in the 3 days we were there before Thanksgiving. After that it was swamped with teenagers. The families with little kids were fine but the unsupervised teenagers annoyed me. Besides the teenagers, the pool was probably the best part. There is a lunch counter in the gift/snack shop as well as a hot dog cart next to the bar and we enjoyed lunch from both on our non-park days. You definitely do not want to do your shopping in the snack shop or even the store at the resort entrance. I forgot to pack hairspray and a bottle of it at the snack shop cost me $7. Go to Walmart to get what you need. As for the suite, we stayed in a first floor one bedroom suite. The layout was odd: the bedroom was right next to the walkway and you could hear everything. We even took a blanket and hung it over the curtain rod because the blinds weren't good enough. My husband ended up sleeping in the living room on the pull-out because other guests would use the luggage cart and roll it past our windows over the brick walkway...very loud. I would have asked for a 2nd floor had we known that. We ended up leaving the pull-out couch pulled out because the couch was more like a wicker loveseat and it was too stiff and formal to relax on. The bathroom and kitchenette were fine for the two of us. The mini fridge fit our water, beer and milk. We had to call twice to get our towels replaced but it was a holiday. I don't think a one bedroom suite is big enough for more than 2 people. We were looking forward to water sports but at the time the lake was closed because of an overgrowth of some lake plant. Probably won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for anyone,great location. We love it!”
Reviews.Author: Funinthesun52
Reviews.Content: We have owned at Star Island since 1998 and we love it! After paying $1,200.00 for just a 2 queen size beds and bath in florida for a week it sucked!!!! . So that's when we bought at Star Island. We have A & B sides. The last time we came it was new years eve 06-07 brought two of our daughters and 3 grandsons and had a blast and it was in the 70's & 80's the whole week!! Great location too!!! It's great for 2 or 10 people. The only thing I wish they had is a kennel or something for your pets.

Reviews.Title: “Average Star Island”
Reviews.Author: JewelieRees
Reviews.Content: As Timeshare Owners, we went to Star Island for a quick 5 day getaway to somewhere warm without snow! 1 Bedroom Suite was CLEAN, well equipped, nice JACUZZI. Elevator service was a plus. The POOL was SMALL, GREASY (a layer of oil and overcrowded). Events were not as fun as other Wyndham resorts. The resort was not a favorite of the Fairfield Wyndham resorts. There was a neat little outdoor fitness area, but the path is incomplete and leads to a dead end (?!?!) Oh, and be aware of aggressive bingo players ;) Location is good though, with a rental car you can go anywhere. We did not navigate the bus system this time. We aren't golfers so I can't comment on the courses available.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort”
Reviews.Author: LINY74
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at Star Island 2x in the past 5 years and have wonderful experiences. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous and the location was just perfect. We would highly recommend this resort. Most of the reviews I have read on this resort are older and they have since updated most of their units.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: MNGecko
Reviews.Content: I am staying at Star Island for the third time in 3 years in a few weeks. Several friends and family of mine have stayed there as well. I love the resort, the staff is friendly and responsive and the activities are great. I will agree that the rooms do need some updating, but they have always been clean and well maintained each time I've stayed there. We've always stayed in the 2 bedroom lock-off - which is perfect for families. It seems that any negative reviews were written by people that only stayed in the "suite" portion of the condos and I will agree that they are small. I think if you stay in a larger unit, you will find that this is a wonderful place to stay and a terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Star Island: It's Okay!!!”
Reviews.Author: beercan67
Reviews.Content: Basically, Wyndham bought a building or 2 at the Star Island resort. I stayed in Building 23. I reserved a one bedroom deluxe-B side Feb. 28th for 3 nights.. The b-sides are the bigger unit. I was in 2333.The room was modern, clean, and spacious.It was nice. The room was 80 plus degrees when I got there, and my thermostat wouldn't cool it down. The furnace wouldn't shut off. I looked in the closet where the furnace was, and I noticed that the furnace was what is called a "2 Zone." It heats and cools the A and B side. Guess who controls the furnace----- the A-SIDE. I found this out after calling maintenance in to see why I couldn't shut it off at my thermostat. Everyone that I talked to including the front desk Manager knows about this problem. It was stated to me that Wyndham Ownership is aware of this problem in all the A-B units, but simply doesn't want to spend the cash to make it right. What Star Island does, is simply wait for the complaint, and then try to move you to either an A unit, or put you in another B- that has nobody in the A side. They moved me to 2362B and nobody was in the A side. I mean, what a [--] way for a billion dollar Company like Wyndham to run an operation. Like I said, they only own a part of an expansive group of buildings at Star Island. Star Island itself is really nice and the pool area is awesome. There is a nice lounge upstairs that is open at 4pm and it overlooks the pool area. The driving range was nice to have. No need to wait for your free bucket of balls between 830 and 930. It's too crowded and it only costs 2 dollars when you pay. I simply waited for the freebie crowd to disperse. The workout facilities are also really nice. I don't work out, I golf and drink beer. Walk over to Friday's and enjoy a cold one and a burger. Like I said, my 2 rooms were both really nice and I think Star Island is a great place in a perfect location to the Disney stuff. It's a quick, easy drive to all of them. I hope Wyndham Ownership gets their act together and fixes the furnace issues in building 23. Otherwise, just get the A-side room. If you get stuck in a B with a person who needs 85 degree heat, do what I figured out. Just go into the fuse box which is in YOUR room, and turn it off. I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: infrequenttraveller3
Reviews.Content: Building 21 - floor 4, in a corner From the outside -we felt like we were living in a low-scale appartment building for one week. We had to walk outside down a narrow concrete walk-way to get to our unit after using a smelly elevator to get to the fourth level. On the inside -the decor is very out-dated. We were in the lock-out unit; parents in B room. The bathroom needs a separate switch for the fan. The way it is now, if you want the light on; you also get the fan. The tennis court looked like it was vandalized - tennis balls everywhere and a locker type cabinet with the door broken off of it....broken rackets on the ground. This resort needs much improvement. We had a depressing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth time as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: GreyLady122
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Star Island four times now and have never had a "bad" experience. We now know that a one bedroom deluxe is our perfect size. I don't remember seeing any bug inside our rooms at anytime. We have always found the rooms clean without even a "closed up" smell that we have found at other resorts. The pool is large with several sections, plus another section of lounges just for sunbathers. The grounds are kept neat and are wonderful to walk around and explore. I like the security of the gated access road. My husband now prefers to stay in Orlando because he has become familiar with the streets there, and especially around this resort. Groceries and restaurants are plentiful and close by. We would recommend this resort to families of any age or size.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - Close to Disney - we had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: LolaV
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two children (ages 7 and 3) just stayed here in late August and had a wonderful time. We had a room in Building 19 - it had one bedroom, one bathroom, mini kitchen and living room. The bedroom had two double beds which was fine for us and the kids. The bedroom and the living room each had a TV. The kitchen had a mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, utensils, plates, cups, and a small box containing some garbage bags, coffee, dishwashing detergent and a sponge. The outside of the resort is clean and the buildings are clearly numbered. We arrived at about 9pm and found parking right in front of the building. There was a luggage cart thing right by the elevators, so I brought that over, we loaded it up and were able to bring all of our luggage up in one trip. (Note - remember to return it for others to use!). Our room was clean, but there was a hint of the smell of smoke when we turned on the air conditioning. There was a washer & dryer right outside our door that I used with no problem. They're small, so they won't hold alot, but they were sufficient to clean our clothes before the return home. We didn't take part in any of the activities onsite, but we did go to the pool. We LOVED the pool. The water temperature was perfect - not freezing cold and not hot. It felt wonderful to jump in there when it was 100 degrees out! The kids had a ball swimming & playing all afternoon in the pool - as did my husband and I. Staff was friendly. You'll see cleaning/maintenance people riding around in golf carts all the time, so someone is always around for assistance if need be. We had no problems at all with parking. One night, we returned at 11pm and had to park a building or two down instead of in front of our building, but no big deal - we're coming back late, so you gotta know that you'll have to park a bit further away - just like anywhere. Disney is close - 4-6miles I believe. You make a left out of the property and continue down the road. There are lights so it may take a bit longer, but our ride was not more than I'd say 10-15mins or so to the Disney parking area. Universal was a jump onto the I-4 Expressway a few exits down - not far at all. There are plenty of restaurants, fast food places and supermarkets (Publix is just around the corner on Vineland). You can find whatever you need nearby. All in all, we had a nice time and would definitely stay again. Accommodations were perfect for what we needed - no complaints other than the smoke smell when turning on the a/c but that disipated after a while.

Reviews.Title: “An underwhelming experience...will not return”
Reviews.Author: lnmstl
Reviews.Content: We are Wyndham owners at Bonnett Creek and had originally booked our stay there. However, we had relatives who wanted to join our group at the last minute and moved to Start Island due to Bonnett Creek being booked. The grounds of the resort are lovely and from our initial look around everything looked very nice. We were in building #25 on the second floor with two 2 bedrooms and a one bedroom that were all located together. It was nice to be close. The condos are all decorated in tacky 80's Florida. Lots of pink, brass and mirrors. Ick! The condos are in desperate need of an update. Everyone laughed at the amount of mirrors used in the master suites. Wow!!!! After the first night we all were commenting on how black the bottoms of our feet were from walking around inside the condos. Very gross!!!! I started wearing socks and the bottoms turned black quickly. On our second morning housekeeping called at 6:45am to tell us someone was on the way with the extra towels we requested. What? At 6:45am? Huh? We hadn't requested towels and it was a mix up with another building. The resort does have a lot of organized activities which we declined to partake in. We did feel very much like we were sitting at the bar every night since we could hear the goings on clearly inside our condos each night. We went to the pool once and it was very crowded at 10pm. The pool water was cloudy and the kids said it was hyper-chlorinated. The one ane only hot tub was over-run with teenagers which was incredibly disappointing. Each morning our family members staying in the other two units received phone calls from the timeshare desk offering them a quick 30 minute tour and presentation. I finally had to call and tell them to leave us all alone that we definately were not interested. The phone calls persisted. I finally stopped by the office and had a heart to heart chat with the manager and we were all left alone after that. When we checked out we had been charged for the towel service we did not request. The desk clerk was rude and I finally had to ask for a manager to get the charge removed from our bill. As VIP members this upset me greatly. I don't expect special treatment but I do think common courtesy and a smile would have gone a long way. This resort is not easy to find and a bit difficult to get in and out of if there is a lot of traffic. It is close to all the theme parks but the traffic makes the trip long at times. If there is any amount of traffic or an accident it can easily take upwards of an hour to get to and from the themeparks. We all agree that Star Island has great potential. It does offer a lot if you plan on staying on property a good deal. There are other properties located closer to the theme parks and I would choose them before returning. I wouldn't shy away from staying here. Just don't expect a five star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: Hobiecat16
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days 4 nights as Fairfield owners. We checked in about 11:00 PM, and headed to our room, only to find it was occupied with sleeping guests! Big surprise for all. Went back to the front desk and was told by the clerk, "Hey, the computer did it, you will have to wait." He was in no mood to fix this problem, as he was currently atttending to other unhappy campers. I found a security gaurd who was sypathetic to tired kids and the resort screw up. He pushed the front desk clerk to fix the problem quickly. Great security, sorry front desk help. Room was very clean, the 1 bedroom was spacious for 2 adults and 2 kids. Kids loved the large whirlpool tub. Pool is very nice, and overall resort is well maintained. Parking is terrible past 7:00, unless you like hiking with tired kids after a day at the parks. Location to parks is not bad, but Bonnet Creek (also Fairfield) is closer, nicer, and far better service. Overall it was average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TJC4
Reviews.Content: This place was phenomenal! Our room was a 3 bedroom deluxe suite. We had 8 people in our room and everybody had a comfortable bed to sleep in. The staff was very courteous. The location was perfect. Just minutes down the road from Disney, Universal Studios and Kennedy Space Center. Also there were activities at the resort that were great for everyone. We were kind of nervous about staying here after we read some of the not so great reviews but after our stay there, you can tell those are the kind of people who have to complain about everything. There isn't anything to complain about. There are people there from Timeshare who want to talk to you about the program. You are not obligated to and we suggest that you don't waste your time. Just tell them you have a very busy schedule. They only called us 1 time and we told them again we were busy and they never bothered us again. We highly recommend Star Island. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good (except for the couch-bed)”
Reviews.Author: etidwell
Reviews.Content: We are recent "vacation property owners" and booked through at Star Island via our timeshare company, Interval. We were planning a two-family (4 adults, 3 kids) vacation and needed plenty of space, so we booked a 3-bedroom suite at the Star Island. Things we loved: Star Island has a nice pool. All the kids loved it, even our 15-month-old daughter. There's a nice little fountain that operated as a kid magnet right by the pool, plus towel and pool toys to borrow right at the poolside. Plenty of parking. The master bedroom in our suite was really spacious, with a wonderful walk-in shower, a nice two-person jacuzzi, a king bed, private toilet, and TV cabinet. A decent full-sized kitchen with a huge fridge, real stove and cooktop, full-sized dishwasher, and plenty of dishes. Balcony with a view of the on-grounds lake. Nice temperature control -- very important when you come from a wussy weather area like Seattle. Decent soundproofing. Even between the two halves of our suite -- our friends did not have to listen to our toddler being cranky in the middle of the night, nor did theirs going to bed late wake ours up. We never heard anyone in the rooms next to us. Things we didn't love: The "queen bed" in the "third bedroom" turned out to be a pull-out couch and was uncomfortable to sleep on. That left us short on beds, since the only real beds were the master bedroom king and the two double beds in the 2nd bedroom. I thought they were a bit stingy with supplies. We were only given soap for two loads of laundry and two loads of dishes, two garbage bags, etc. Granted, we did not ask for more, so maybe it wouldn't have been a problem. Linens are replaced once in the middle of the week. The kitchen was a little understocked as far as pots and pans. Ok, not bad, but I would've liked a muffin tin and a few more utensils at the least. The Star Island does NOT have Internet service; you have to dial out, and there's a charge for all phone calls out. I was surprise there was no normal housecleaning, but really, even with 3 kids it's not that much trouble to pick up after yourself. One thing I was unimpressed with was the washer/dryer. Better than nothing, but those stackable units only do tiny loads. And, the dryer didn't work well at all, it either dried everything on HOT or cold, no medium air temps. Location: The location is really pretty close to the whole Disney complex -- we found it very convenient. There are tons of restaurants, a Target, Publix, and Walmart nearby for people who plan to buy food and cook or need to pick up other supplies. Lots of gift shops. Lots of designer outlet shopping. The Star Island doesn't have a shuttle to Disney, so you'll have to rent a car or pay like $20per person to get there. The Star Island grounds are pretty big so you're actually a good distance from the main drag, so a car is the better way to go anyhow. It was about 10-15 min to Disney, 15 min to Seaworld, an hour to the Kennedy Center and Cocoa Beach. Decor: A little worn, and I wasn't impressed with the glass & stone tables, especially with two toddlers in residence. Fortunately no one fell on any of the stone or konked their heads against the jacuzzi tile surround. Timeshare stuff: We did end up going to the timeshare presentation, but they didn't try to work us much. It probably helps to bring a fussy toddler but I think we were there for maybe 30 minutes, and were rewarded with $75 for going. "Minorities housed in the back" -- a previous review made this comment which I found to be weird and untrue. We were in building 20 right smack in the back and don't recall seeing any great concentration of minorities there. We were "assigned" our unit number when we booked, which was done in total anonymity via the Internet! Overall, this was our first resort experience, and we were pleasantly surprised. It could be nicer, but it definitely beats most hotels we've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Worst timeshare resort we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: wdwfanatics
Reviews.Content: We are owners of Fairfield points (not at this location). We booked this resort because Bonnet Creek wasn't available. I was not so sure about staying here after reading some of the reviews. We tried it anyways because looking on various websites this looks like a wonderful resort. It's not. Many of the reviews here I do agree with. We checked in Apr 29 for a week long stay. The people there are very nice. The 2br is a lockout. The connecting doors wouldn't stay open, there is a spring on the hinges. I didn't like this because the younger children stayed in that "2nd bedroom" and were really seperated from us. The bathtub is almost thigh high so it is very difficult to step in and out of and the water preasure is not the greatest. The fan in the bathroom is extremely loud. The pool is small and the activities were poor. The elevator still makes a scary noise. Now for the really bad stuff. The first morning we woke up 6am to bugs in our bed and bites all over our upper bodies. We called the front desk and spoke to management. They wanted to move us to a different room 3 building over. We had groceries and all of our things to move. My husband spoke to the operations manager, telling her that many villas in our building were vacant, why can't we move within our building. She checked and allowed us to move one room over. The old room was exterminated and vacant for the rest of that week. We left one of the bugs in a ziploc bag to help them identify it. The new room...no bugs but the toilet was not bolted to the floor. This resort is very old but does have alot of potential. The location is excellent. I more than likely will not stay here again. Fairfield did comp some points (with many restrictions) to us. I get that creepy feeling just thinking about that first night.

Reviews.Title: “Explain what "lock off means"”
Reviews.Author: branmuffins88
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Sunday night. The entrance is not easily located because the is so much going on in the area. We passed the one and only sign several times which is really hard to see. Check in was fairly easy. Before we arrived I called Fairfield (or what ever they changed their name too) because I was concerned about the beds in the unit. (2 full size and a queen pull out) They said this was the only unit available. So we sucked it up and made the best of it. We were given our key and sent way to the back of the facility. We were also told that they would give us a call because we were VIP owners. They wanted to take about 1/2 hour of our time to update us on the all of the changes. We know they can't tell time (except for check in and out) so we didn't fall for that. We didn't answer the phone!!! Our "lock off" unit was located on the ground floor. The unit was clean and nicely decorated. The beds were small. That was a big problem. I am 5'10" and my husband is 6'8". We didn't fit. The pull out bed was so uncomfortable, we ended up dragging the mattress into the front room and using the sofa cushions to complete our bed. Well sleeping in the front room had it's disadvantages. Between the noise outside the window from walk by traffic and the daily activities from next door, ( paper thin walls) sleep was low on the priority list. What is up with the exhaust fan!!!! The jacuzzi was small but I guess it served it's purpose. We didn't get a chance to take a dip in the pool. Due to lack of sleep we snoozed late, the pool was too crowded. Something else we noticed, we only saw minorities in the back housed toward the rear of the facility. Maybe it was our imagination but that was the only place we saw them. Anyway the resort is located right in the middle of every and anything you want to eat. I love the location but as I said before it needs better location indicators. It was easy to get to all of the attractions. My biggest problem was I didn't feel like I was treated like a VIP owner.(what ever that is suppose to be) Now that I know what a "lock off" unit is I will never stay in a "GROUNDFLOORONEBEDROOMLOCKOFFUNIT" (that's how close we were!) again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay for hectic Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: kewlfivePennsylvania
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to write a review about Star Island... I am a Fairfield owner, and I read the other reviews. I booked our stay, but was somewhat anxious about our stay... Our stay started out by being given keys to a room that was already occupied. I was very upset, as was my husband. We had unpacked all of our belongings from our vehicle, and all six of us were standing in a room that wasn't ours, with multiple suitcases and tired from our entire day of traveling... That being said, when we went back to the front desk, the clerk appologized profusely. That was our ONLY bad experience with Star Island. (My husband was also upset because we usually could not park right in front of our building.) However, our entire week was a blast at Star Island. I purchased 7day tickets to Disney, and only used 4 days. We spent the other days at the resort. A huge super Walmart is 1 1/2 miles away. (Check out Walmart's Disney section for Disney t-shirts, etc before you spend all of your hard-earned dough at Disney!) The kids volunteered to miss MGM Studios so they could use the pool. The pool was very kid-friendly, and was heated (which was appreciated during our early-March visit). We enjoyed the poolside activities also, such as build your own sundaes, who can make the biggest splash, noodle races, etc. Charlie Chaplain roams around in the morning, and makes balloon animals, hats, etc. for the kids. There is also a moon bounce set up for the kids to use for free. Our room overlooked the tennis courts. I enjoyed sitting on our 5th floor balcony in the morning, and watching the tennis instructor with his students. Star Island has a driving range, which my husband and children really enjoyed. If you go at a certain time, they give you a free bucket of balls. (You will be given a list of all activities when you check in.) The decor in the room suited us fine. My husband's not into pink, but we enjoyed the huge jacuzzi bathtub in our bedroom. I also enjoyed the huge shower! We had a 2 bedroom lock-off unit. The den on the smaller side had a sofa-bed, which my teenage son turned into a bedroom for himself. There is so much to see and do in Orlando, and the traffic is horrible. However, I really was able to relax and unwind at Star Island. I would absolutely not hesitate to take my family (which included myself, my husband, my mother, and our 3 children) back to Star Island.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Star Island”
Reviews.Author: mattyzgrl68
Reviews.Content: We were a bit nervous after reading the reviews, the night before we left for vacation...and as it goes, nothing seemed to be going right! But when we finally arrived at Star Island (early) our room was not yet ready. We were three hours early and exhausted fom the long drive, but upon check-in they took our cell phone number & said they would try to put a rush on it. We went to lunch & upon arriving back, our phone rang to let us know our room was ready. We went up to our room (a 3 BR deluxe) and it was just as descibed! Clean, huge and lovely! The kids loved it!! The master suite was perfect....it had a jacuzzi tub, king size bed, very large shower, double sink and private toilet. It was set up beautifully including the way they hung the towels in a neat design. It was perfect! We even had a washer & dryer in the room. The appliances were up to date & the cabinets were fully stocked with everything...pots.pans,plates, bowls, silverware, etc., etc.....The pool area/bar was gorgeous...as well as the lobby...yes, it did cost $1.00 for 3 mins. of internet, but it was located just off the lobby and quite convenient. They had a FREE towel exchange on that Thurs. and delivered the towels promptly. Each night was a different event at the pool side bar...bingo, cookouts to welcome the guests, BBQ & Italian night.....I was very impressed by Star Island and my family can not wait to go back in the near future....Jenny, Matt & Family Selkirk, NY

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: homeschoolgal
Reviews.Content: After a terrible experience at the Radisson Celebration, we checked out early and drove around looking for another place to stay. We stopped by Star Island that I had checked out online before we left. We got a room for the remaining 5 night stay for only $55 a night if we would listen to a time share speil. The room: It was spacious. It was not terribly clean. It was not an efficient layout. The kids had to sleep on a pull out bed that was so uncomfortable that we called for an extra mattress and they slept on the floor. The sheets on the king bed were cheap and scratchy, and the mattress pad was way too small and synthetic and moved around and bunched up at night. The pillows were terrible and very cheap. You about had to kill yourself getting into and out of the large jacuzzi tub, as it was poorly laid out with no step in our out, so you had to walk along the slick marble edging to get out or in. Also, we ran out of hot water before it was filled up completely. The stand up shower did not drain properly and always had some water in it. The toilet continually ran and made noise. The decore was out of date 80's Floridian. Our room key locked us out the second to last day. We called and let them know and asked if they would have it working by the time we got back from Disney the following day. We got back late on Friday and guess what? It was still not working. My husband had to go to the front desk who didn't offer an apology, and we had to wait in the car for about 15 minutes until security showed up to open the door. We never had a room key that worked the rest of the time we were there. We just didn't leave the room again without some in it to open the door. The walls were so thin that we could hear the small children crying and making noise next door. The loud Kaoreoke music at the pool EVERY night until 11 was heard as if in our own living room. The kids had a hard time going to sleep. You had to pay $25 a day for maid service, extra towels and toilet paper. There was no internet hook up in the room, and you had to pay extra for the one they had in the lobby. They even charged 75 cents a call for local calls. This hotel does not seem 5 star to me. I think whoever gave them the 5 star rating is watering down the rating system. How can you trust the star ratings if this is 5 star? The time share presentation: Lets see. It was supposed to take 90 minutes and offered a free breakfast. Well, the breakfast and coffee were inedible. The salesman was "just there to help us", and "this isn't a high pressure sales pitch. You can go whenever you want, as I have many people waiting who are wanting to buy". 3 hours later, we had repeatedly said we weren't interested, they kept saying they would give us 1 more minute alone to discuss it, kept offereing us a "better deal", and when we finally had kids doing headstands and we were getting up to leave anyway, they were noticably not happy with our refusal, even though it was "no pressure". There went half of Wednesday. It was a small price to pay though for $55 a night, even if the place was 4 star at best. When I went to check out the staff was not very friendly. When I asked for a receipt, they couldn't help me since it was a time share deal. When I went to the time share office no one was there, so I left without one. I have no idea what all they are charging me at this time. In closing, I thought the place was spacious but outdated and not very well laid out. It wouldn't be worth the almost $300 nightly rate at all. They nickle and dime you to death, and you do not feel you are at a top notch resort at all. However, the grounds were nice to look at.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 Star Place”
Reviews.Author: debiamp
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my week at Fairfield Star Island and was compelled to write a review so people do not go here. This resort is rated 5 Star through Interval International and I will do everything I can to get that investigated. I booked this through a vacation getaway and did not check reviews because it was supposed to be 5 star. So you would think all should be fine. NOT. FIrst, upon check in the person was not welcoming, not friendly and not informative. I also asked if there was internet and was told wireless in the lobby and an internet cafe upstairs. That was not true. And it is not free. The only internet access was at the pool bar and outside. It was noisy and in the early AM was cold. The kitchen appliances were very old and poor quality, one of the stove burners did not work and the inside of the kitchen cabinets were filthy. The entire place needed a good cleaning in general. The games in the game room were broken. The amenities - you have to pay for everything, except use of the pool. They have jet skis and kayaks but I would not even let my dog go in that lake. It is more like a dirty lagoon. And if you want clean towels you have to pay $9 each time. There is no housekeeping unless you want to pay $25.00 per day. II really needs to go look at this place and re-rate it so people do not get fooled by the 5 Star rating. Apparently they are not all created equal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: KEEPTRAVELLIN
Reviews.Content: We were really nervous when we read some of the reviews of this resort. I even called the resort personally to tell them they were getting bad reviews and hoped I wouldn't have any problems with the rooms, service, etc. We are Fairfield owners so there are certain buildings that Fairfield owners actually stay in. We brought a huge group (we had booked about 7-8 rooms) and all were just beautiful! The service was great, and no bugs like some of the reviews stated. We brought our baby daughter and if there were any bugs, we would have been out of there quick! The staff were just wonderful to us and all of our guests. We were treated very well. Now I don't if that is because we were Fairfield owners or not, but I do know that some of the reviews seem a bit exaggerated. All of our guests really enjoyed the stay. Rooms - Yes, I agree with some of the reviews there. The decoration is a bit too "Florida" for me, but it was nice. Particulary the newer buildings which had more up-to-date furniture, etc. Hassle from timeshare company? - Not with us. We always call ahead or mention at checkin to not bother us or our guests. When we do that, no one bothers us. We call them if we need to discuss additional timeshare ownership. It turned out that most of our guests wanted to listen to them so it worked out ok.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings About My Stay”
Reviews.Author: carlbarry
Reviews.Content: Arrival I was very pleasantly surprised at how beautiful the grounds of the resort are. I arrived at about 2 PM, well before the 4 PM check in time. The front desk person took my cell phone number, "in case the room is ready early." About 3:15 I went back to the front desk to inquire about the room, and was told it was ready. Never received the promised phone call. I was given a "lock-out" A room, way in the back of the facility. I was told that I was lucky, as it "overlooks the lake." Well, what it overlooked was a walkway and maintenance sheds. The bedroom window overlooked a stairwell. Therefore, not only could anybody walking by look in if the blinds were opened, it was noisy due to passers-by and echoes in the stairwell. By the way-all the employees I encountered were unfailingly polite and friendly. The Room The room was nice, clean, and fairly spacious. The beds were really too small to sleep 2 apiece. And the pillows were horrible. Also, the jacuzzi was useless; not only did the low-set jets bang my kidneys, but between the noise of the jets, and the noise of the exhaust fan, you could go deaf! Unfortunately, the walls must be paper thin; I could hear every sound made by the family next door. And when they would run their washing machine at 11:40 PM, it would sound like a truck was going through my room. For some reason, when I arrived back from Epcot my last night, my room card key had been canceled, and I had to wait for security to come and let me in. Just symptomatic of the poor organization here. By the way, I always found a parking space near the elevator for my unit. The Resort As I said, the grounds are beautiful. Also, there seems to be plenty of activities during the day and night. The Pitch I had a 3 night/4 day business gift to stay here. When I called to confirm, I was told I could get another day if I went to a "1 1/2 hour to 2 hour presentation." Little did I know what I was getting into! I was scheduled for the pitch my second day, in the early afternoon (thus effectively killing the day), at another location: Bonnet Creek. Well, that is one fantastic resort. But the pitch lasted a grueling 3 1/2 hours! The Location The resort is located off a rather tacky highway. But the good part is, if you are so inclined, there are many national fast food places there, and nearby CVS, Publix, a giant Wal Mart (the place to pick up your souvenirs!), etc. Also, it is near Old Town, other main arteries, and fairly close to Disney. If you need a Chabad House, there is one about 15 minutes away, with daily services. If you don't know what Chabad is, you don't need it! ;-) My Conclusion I was really annoyed by the day killed by the pitch, and the location of my room. The noise was very unpleasant. So I wouldn't say this is a top place. But if you have a "B" unit, and want to partake of the resort's facilities, I'm pretty sure you'll have a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs in room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort thru a time-share rental I found on redweek.com. We were assured we had booked a two bedroom condo. When we arrived we were told we had a one bedroom with a lockout and that there was not even a two bedroom condo on site (?). In our room I discovered one cockroach (in the dishwasher). A small infestation of giant ladybugs that mainly stuck to the ceiling but did find their way to the kitchen, or my dtr's shoulder, and on the floor. There were also centipedes, I believe I found three over the course of our 1 week stay. Our room however was very spacious except that the bedroom in the lockout was small with two double beds (we were assured two queens). The LR area had one small sofa that was sort of half of a sectional. It felt like we were missing a chair. The pool was very crowded and there was only one small hot tub. The elevator made so many strange noises we decided it was scarier than any theme park ride. This was our 4th visit to Orlando and have always stayed in a vacation resort. I have never found bugs before in my room. I found this resort to be very tired and worn looking. The resort may have been nice at one time, however it has not been maintained to meet my standards. A little paint can go a long way!

Reviews.Title: “not impressed, have had better stays in other locations”
Reviews.Author: jenaye
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 2 night stay at Star Island after a week long stay at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club at Sea World (see my review for this resort, I highly recommend it) Both stays were as timeshare tradeouts through RCI. Star Island wasn't even in the same league as the HGVC in my opinion. Their 3 bedroom unit was a 2 bedroom with a 1 bedroom lock-off. (Not the case at HGVC) The 3rd bedroom wasn't really a bedroom, a pull out sofa. Very dated, typical florida decor... green, pink, lots of mirrors and fake marble. A little to cheesy for me. I found it odd that for a unit that could hold as many as 8 people they had only 1 sofa that could comfortably seat maybe 4 people. That's it. No chairs. There was a big empty space where it seemed like chairs should be but there weren't any. Again for a max of 8 people they provided a dining table that held 6. No light darkening curtains on any window. The 2 windows in the pull-out "bedroom" faced onto the exterior hallway which was lit all night long so that room was quite bright during the night. It seemed clean with the exception of 1 creepy crawly roach type guest. The bathroom in the lock-off portion looked like it may have been recently re-done. It just didn't quite match the rest of the decor. It also had a very odd jacuzzi shower combo where the tub was raised up quite bit. My husband is 5'9" and he had to duck his head to get under the shower. Anyone much taller might have to duck to avoid the ceiling. Kind of weird. Big gaps around the exterior doors. Lots of cobwebs on the exteriors. Loud live music both nights at different areas of the property. Some sort of outdoor concerts. If our unit had backed up to live music all night long I would have freaked. Luckily we weren't right next door to it. I reviewed this property as not impressed because I've stayed at much better in Orlando and if better is available why not stay there. There are new timeshares being built all the time. I see no reason to stay somewhere that isn't as nice. One positive note, we were able to check-in quite early, around 11:00 AM.
